properties.areaDesc: Heard, GA; Carroll, GA; Coweta, GA
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 6 at 6:01PM EST until February 8 at 1:54PM EST by NWS Peachtree City GA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a Flood
Warning for the following rivers in Georgia...

Chattahoochee River near Whitesburg affecting Carroll...Coweta and
Heard Counties

Flint River near Lovejoy affecting Clayton...Fayette and Spalding
Counties

Flint River near Griffin Hwy. 16 affecting Fayette and Spalding
Counties

Flint River near Molena affecting Meriwether and Pike Counties

Flint River near Carsonville Hwy. 19 affecting Crawford...
Talbot...Taylor and Upson Counties


.Recent heavy rainfall has caused significant runoff into streams and
rivers which will cause flooding in some areas.

The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a
* Flood Warning for
The Chattahoochee River near Whitesburg.
* From late tonight until Saturday afternoon.
* At 530 PM Thursday the stage was 13.5 feet, and rising.
* Minor flooding is forecast to develop.
* Flood stage is 17 feet.
* The river is forecast to rise above flood stage after midnight
early Friday morning, then continue rising, reaching near 19.9
feet by Friday evening. The river is expected to fall below flood
stage Saturday morning.
* At 15 feet, bankfull conditions are reached along the river
upstream and downstream from the gage on U.S. Highway 27, or
Georgia Highway 16.

At 17 feet, minor flooding begins in the woodlands and fields along
the river upstream and downstream from the gage on U.S. Highway 27,
or Georgia Highway 16. Flood waters reach the top of the boat ramp
at Riverside Park next to the bridge. The playground at a day use
area on the west side of the Chattahoochee Bend State Park will
begin to flood.

At 19 feet, minor flooding continues in the woodlands and fields
upstream and downstream from the gage at U.S. Highway 27, or Georgia
Highway 16. The parking lot of Riverside Park next to the bridge
will begin to flood. A sod farm upstream also experiences flooding.
Flooding occurs on some unimproved dirt roads along the river. The
playground at a day use area in the Chattahoochee Bend State Park
will be under two feet of water and flood waters will surround tent
platforms on the North Camping Site of the park.
properties.instruction:
All persons with interests along the river should monitor the latest
forecasts...and be prepared to take necessary precautions to protect
life and property.

The latest stage data was furnished in cooperation with the United
States Geological Survey.
